column4: I've had a issue for a few days and not sure what I did to cause it. When I switch to my first desktop it switchs very slowly (hangs for a few seconds) when I switch to my second desktop it switchs almost instantly. what could be causing this?
did you install compiz or beryl
not that i know of. is there a way to easily check?
you'd know...
you could try making a new user account and see if it is just something with your profile
lol any idea how to get my touch pad to work with the new user account since it seams it doesn't by default?
/etc/X11/xorg.conf
can that be edited by a standard user? and is it different for each user?
ummm you have to be root
is xorg.conf different for each user? if not i'm not sure how this is going to fix it:-/
I believe there is only one copy... but that is where your touchpad would be as a device
well the touch pad works on my main user and is listed in xorg.conf
ok so what is different there or how did you get it working before
tryin something now
try to use the new account to figure out why it's slow then go back to your main account
can't have two users logged in at the same time (switching users) it seams and still have full capabilies
the new users desktop works correctly
ok then you know it is something specific to your account profile... can you get the touchpad installed on the new user?

if i have both users logged in at the same time the touchpad won't work and when i go to switch off the other user the system locks up. I rebooted and just went into the new user account and the touch pad worked fine
man gdm
where is the profile for the users desktop stored? and what would I be looking for?
I dunno maybe gconf?
found it. had desktop effects turned on. turned them off and back on and it fixed it
yeah that is beryl or compiz or something like this
